page.title: 10JOHN O'GAUNT WORKSHOPS
page.content: A GRACEFUL VIADUCT WITH 14 ARCHES AND A PRESERVATION ORDER PLACED ON IT THIS YEAR IS A REMINDER OF JOHN O'GAUNT RAILWAY STATION BUILT 1879. BUSY IN ITS DAY,AN 1887 TIMETABLE SHOWS THAT 24 TRAINS STOPPED THERE EACH WEEKDAY. LOCALLE RECALL 100 HORSES WITH GROOMS AND SECONDS, TAKEN OFF THE TRAIN READY TO JOIN THE QUORN HUNT.THE STATION CLOSED 1964 . THE CO-OC CREAMERY WAS BUILT ALONGSIDE THE PLATFORM TO SEND MILK AND CREAM, LATER TURNED TO ROAD TRANSPORT AND FINALLY CLOSED IN 1977. TODAY THE STATION SITE IS OWNED BY MR ATTON, WHO HAS DEVELOPED THE OLD CREAMERY INTO SEVERAL LIGHT INDUSTRIAL UNITS, OCCUPIED BY A PRINTER, CARPENTER, MECHANIC, MAKER OF LAMPSHADES WINDOW FRAMES ETC.
